text: About the earlier discussion of Windows versions - at what point should Julia drop support for Windows 7?  It is no longer updated, extended support ran out a year ago, and with all of the security issues around the world lately, does it make sense to continue supporting it?

elements.text: About the earlier discussion of Windows versions - at what point should Julia drop support for Windows 7?  It is no longer updated, extended support ran out a year ago, and with all of the security issues around the world lately, does it make sense to continue supporting it?

text: It is already listed as "Tier 3" on the downloads page.

elements.text: It is already listed as "Tier 3" on the downloads page.

text: True, but totally drop support, so we don’t have to think about coding to pre Windows 10 (granted, I wouldn’t be upset if direct support for Windows was dropped entirely! :nerd_face:) How well does Julia run using the Linux subsystem?

elements.text: True, but totally drop support, so we don’t have to think about coding to pre Windows 10 (granted, I wouldn’t be upset if direct support for Windows was dropped entirely!
